item.title: System requirements for PrestaShop 8
item.description: .h-version-titles th:not(:first-child) { text-align: center; } .support-yes, .example-yes { background-color: #8ce48c; text-align: center; } .support-no, .example-no { background-color: #e89b9b; } .example-yes, .example-no { display: inline-block; width: 1.1rem; height: 1.1rem; margin-bottom: -2px; } System requirements for PrestaShop 8PrestaShop needs the following server configuration in order to run: System: Unix, Linux or Windows. Web server: Apache Web Server 2.4 or any later version. (Although compatible, Apache Web Server 2.2 is not recommended since it reached its EOL in 2018).

item.title: Installing a local environment
item.description: Installing PrestaShop for developmentNow that you intend to develop for PrestaShop, you are better off keeping all your development work on your machine. The main advantage is that it makes it possible for you to entirely bypass the process of uploading your file on your online server in order to test it. Another advantage is that a local test environment enables you to test code without the risk of breaking your production store.

item.title: Installing PrestaShop from CLI
item.description: Installing PrestaShop from CLISince version 1.5.4, PrestaShop has a command-line installer. This special installer makes it possible to install PrestaShop without the need to use a web browser: simply put the content of the zip archive on your web server or pull code from an official PrestaShop repository, and you can install PrestaShop through your command-line interface (CLI). If deploying from sources (PrestaShop repository), you must first install Composer dependencies.

item.title: Installing PrestaShop with Docker
item.description: Installing PrestaShop with DockerPrestaShop is available through Docker for testing/experimenting and developing modules or themes. Docker is an open-source platform that enables developers to package applications and their dependencies into lightweight, portable containers. It provides an efficient and consistent way to build, ship, and run software across different environments. Docker’s website PrestaShop’s Docker Github repository PrestaShop’s Docker Hub The easiest way to begin with PrestaShop on Docker is to run your stack with Docker Compose.

item.title: Configure Apache Http
item.description: Configure Apache HttpdThe following file is provided as an example configuration for your Apache server. It may be incomplete, and remember you must adapt it for your own server’s needs! In Apache 2.4, Order Allow,Deny has been replaced by Require all granted. We assume you are using Apache Http 2.4 or higher. With mod_php/PHP-CGI<VirtualHost *:80> # or 443 for SSL support ServerName example.com DocumentRoot /path/to/prestashop # SSLEngine on # SSLCertificateFile /etc/apache2/ssl/example.
